intro: Sebaea cymosa, commonly known as the clustered sebaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sebaea cymosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or disturbed areas.
